Okay, so my first question is regarding the debate between proof of work and

obviously, other than the energy waste, you also want to have an incentive

like the security of proof of work versus proof of stake. In particular,
imagine I'm not a rational player. I just want to attack the system and break the
consistency. Do you think the proof of stake approach actually increases the cost of

>> Yeah, sure. I would love to. So firstly, I would say like, okay, proof of work is not
asynchronously safe, right? And it's one of the main differences actually between
proof of stake and proof of work is that proof of stake you can actually achieve
like, kind of finality, right? And like actually decisions that are not going to be

And I think that in terms of the damage that an attack could do, the fact that

the fact that when they do, when the safety failure does happen, the faults are
attributable and the nodes who attack can lose money means that the nodes who are
attacking can operate at a higher cost than nodes who are not attacking, which is
not the case in proof of work. So I think, you know, for those reasons and more,
like proof of stake is like going to be more expensive to attack and your attack is
